intro: Heteranthocidium bryocladium, commonly known as the mossy clubmoss, is a species of lycophyte that exhibits unique botanical features. It belongs to the family Lycopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, spore-bearing cones called strobili. The plant has a creeping rhizome with spirally arranged leaves that are typically narrow and linear. Its reproductive structures are clustered at the tips of the stems, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Heteranthocidium bryocladium plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
